name: Casablanca
fun_fact: Fun fact: Despite the famous 1942 film, 'Casablanca' was never actually filmed in Morocco - it was shot entirely in Hollywood! But the city does have Rick's CafÃ©, built in 2004 as a replica of the movie's fictional bar.

hero_dishes.name: Tagine
hero_dishes.description: Slow-cooked stew of meat, vegetables, and spices in a conical clay pot
hero_dishes.origin_story: The cone-shaped lid returns condensation to keep food moist. Each region has signature versions - Casablanca favors fish tagine
hero_dishes.where_to_find: La Sqala, Le Rouget de l'Isle, traditional restaurants throughout the medina

hero_dishes.name: Couscous
hero_dishes.description: Steamed semolina grains served with vegetables, meat, and broth
hero_dishes.origin_story: The North African staple - traditionally served on Fridays after mosque. UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Every traditional restaurant, especially on Fridays

hero_dishes.name: Pastilla (Bisteeya)
hero_dishes.description: Sweet-savory pie with pigeon or chicken, almonds, and powdered sugar in layers of warqa pastry
hero_dishes.origin_story: Originally from Fez, this intricate dish layers savory meat with sweet almonds - the ultimate Moroccan celebration food
hero_dishes.where_to_find: La Sqala, upscale Moroccan restaurants, special occasions

hero_dishes.name: Fresh Seafood
hero_dishes.description: Grilled fish, sardines, and shellfish from the Atlantic
hero_dishes.origin_story: Casablanca's port location means exceptional fresh seafood - sardines are especially beloved
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Port area restaurants, Le Cabestan, La Corniche seafood spots

signature_drinks.name: Mint Tea
signature_drinks.description: Green tea with fresh mint and plenty of sugar, poured from height to create foam
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Multiple times daily - the pouring ritual is as important as the taste. Never refuse an offer of tea

signature_drinks.name: Fresh Orange Juice
signature_drinks.description: Freshly squeezed Moroccan oranges at juice stalls
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: At market stalls - Morocco's oranges are incredibly sweet

food_culture_notes: Friday couscous is sacred family time
Ramadan brings special foods like harira soup and chebakia sweets
La Sqala restaurant is in a beautiful 18th-century fortress
Central Market (MarchÃ© Central) has incredible fresh produce and fish

landmarks: Hassan II Mosque (3rd largest in world)
